isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE CRANK INHIBIT SYSTEM (ECI) - ENGINE CRANK INHIBIT RELAY

svcproc.title: ENGINE CRANK INHIBIT RELAY
svcproc.para: The Engine Crank Inhibit relay controls the current to the start relay. Turning the ignition key to the start position supplies current to energize the relay at terminal 85. If the engine is not running the ECM terminal 46 will enable the relay by supplying a ground circuit to terminal 86 of the relay. Current for the start relay is supplied through the neutral safety switch if the transmission is in neutral with an automatic transmission to terminal 30. Or if the truck is equipped with a manual transmission, current will be supplied to the relay through the clutch switch if the clutch pedal is depressed. With the relay closed current can then pass through the relay to terminal 86 to power the start relay.
